textBeforeTable: Patent Citations 4. A method according to claim 2 wherein another rotating head and collector pan is provided on the opposite side of said conveyor belt, and, joining said collected strands from said pans to form a bundle on said conveyor belt before they are carried to said compactor. 3. A method according to claim 2 wherein said pan is rotated at about six revolutions per minute. feeding sugar granuals to said head. 2. A method according to claim 1 wherein said step of extruding comprises heating said head to a temperature exceeding the melting point of sugar, and cutting the sized product into sections of predetermined length. carrying the collected strands on said conveyor through a compactor to size the collected strands to a predetermined height and width, and collecting said strands in a rotating pan in the center of which said head is disposed, pulling the collected strands upwardly from said pan onto a conveyor belt mounted at the side of said pan and traveling in a direction tangential to said pan at a linear speed slightly greater than the tangential speed at the periphery of said pan, l. A method of making cotton candy comprising the steps of extruding melted sugar through a plurality of apperturcs in a rotating head to provide continuous strands of sugar, What is claimed is: While
